articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Educational Aid Fund and Stipends
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Educational Aid Fund and Stipends
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent education aid fund and stipends amounting to 165,200,000 yen to the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan. It was sent for the democratic national education of children of compatriots in Japan on the occasion of the 99th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The aid fund and stipends sent by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il so far total 46 759 450 390 yen on 157 installments.

articles.title: April Spring Friendship Art Festival Opens
articles.content:
April Spring Friendship Art Festival Opens 
						
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival was opened with due ceremony at the Ryugyong Jong Ju Yong Indoor Stadium on April 10. 
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kang Nung Su, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Minister of Culture An Tong Chun, chairman of the Festival Organizing Committee, Ryang Man Gil, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, officials concerned and working people here. 
					
					 Also present were foreign and overseas Korean artistes, delegations of various countries, diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here, staff members of foreign embassies here, foreign guests and overseas compatriots. 
					
					 An Tong Chun in his opening speech said that the festival would provide the foreign artistes with a significant occasion for exchanging success and experience gained in the development of culture and making a contribution to the development of the human culture and arts.
					
					 Convinced that the festival would be successful as expected by the Korean people and progressive cultural artistes, he declared the festival open. 
					
					 Foreign and DPRK artistes hoisted the festival flag. 
					
					 Congratulatory speeches were made by Zhang Hao, head of the Jilin Provincial Symphony Orchestra of China, and Jean-Francois Mancel, member of the National Assembly under the People's Movement Union of France who is a guest of honor of the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival.
					
					 The DPRK artistes gave a performance at the ceremony.

articles.title: Participants in April Art Festival Feted
articles.content:
Participants in April Art Festival Feted 
						
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The Organizing Committee of the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival hosted a reception at the Yanggakdo International Hotel Sunday in honor of the participants in the festival.
					 Present there on invitation were the foreign artistes and overseas Korean artistes participating in the festival.
					
					 Also present were An Tong Chun, minister of Culture, who chairs the organizing committee, and the vice-chairmen of the committee and officials concerned.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Marathon Held
articles.content:
Marathon Held 
						
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The IAAF-24th Mangyongdae Prize Marathon took place here on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Its opening ceremony was held at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Sunday.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Tong Jong Ho, minister of Construction and Building Materials Industry who is chairing the Marathon Association of the DPRK, and officials concerned, sportspersons and working people in the city of Pyongyang.  Marathoners of the DPRK and those from China, Russia, Namibia, South Africa, Sweden, Ethiopia, Zimbabwe and Kenya were present.
					
					 Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, in an opening address expressed belief that this race would contribute to deepening friendship among sportspersons desirous of independence, peace and friendship and jointly developing the marathon technique.
					
					 The flag of the race was hoisted to be followed by the race.
					
					 Over 300 male and female marathoners left the starting line.
					
					 Russian marathoner Marusin Oleg (male) and DPRK marathoner Ro Un Ok (female) took the first place while Kenyan Mwange Morris Mureithi (male) and Korean An Un Suk (female) came second and South African Ngakane David Rasefako (male) and Korean Pak Jong Nyo (female) came third.
					
					 Trophy cups, medals and diplomas of merit went to the marathoners who proved successful.

articles.title: Foreigners Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Foreigners Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung 
						
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Foreigners visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on April 10 to pay respect to President Kim Il Sung.  They included Jean-Francois Mancel, member of the National Assembly under the People's Movement Union of France, and his party.
					 Jean-Francois Mancel is a guest of honor of the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival.
					
					 The guests paid tribute to the President in humble reverence for him.
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Sinuiju Martyrs Cemetery Completed
articles.content:
Sinuiju Martyrs Cemetery Opened to Public
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The Sinuiju Martyrs Cemetery has been built in the DPRK. 
					 The remains of martyrs and persons of merits were buried in the cemetery. 
					
					 They devoted their noble lives to the country's liberation and its prosperity and reunification, remaining faithful to the idea and leadership of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Among them were anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr Paek Nam Jun, anti-Japanese patriotic martyrs Im Jong Sun, Im Yong Sik, Kim Thaek Yong and Min Jong Sik, Hong Yong Gun and Ri Song Chol, heroes of the DPRK. There are also Ho Chon Hak, Hwang Sun Hwa, Sim Hyong Sok, Ri Sok Myong, Ryu Ki Dong, Sonu Ryon Su who were members of the ten Party members of Rakwon and Hong Sun Han, former vice-chairman of the Unjon County People's Committee, and others. 
					
					 A completing ceremony was held on April 10.
					
					 Present there were officials of the party and power organs and working people's organizations, the bereaved families and working people in North Phyongan Province. 
					
					 The participants placed wreaths and bunches of flowers before the cemetery and paid silent tribute to the memory of the martyrs.
					
					 After the ceremony, they looked round the cemetery.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Remarks of US and S. Korea Blasted
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Remarks of US and S. Korea Blasted
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the warmongers of the U.S. Defense Department and the south Korean Ministry of Defense launched the "policy committee for extended deterrence" in Hawaii under the pretext of coping with someone's "threat of nuclear weapons and WMD". At this confab, they assessed what they called "the level of threat" of the DPRK's "WMD" including nuclear weapons and examined measures and alternatives for sharing information and making effective use of them. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The committee was aimed to specify the preparations for a new Korean war and secure a pretext for provoking a war. 
					
					 The "level of threat" touted by them clearly shows how desperately they are trying to brand the DPRK as a "criminal".
					
					 It is a height of effrontery for the U.S. warmongers to make profound confusion of right and wrong and find fault with the DPRK under the pretext of its non-existent "threat". It is their sinister aim to convince the public that real threat comes from the DPRK and shift the blame on to it in a bid to justify their hostile policy toward the DPRK and ignite the second Korean war any moment based on it. 
					
					 It is pursuant to this plan that the U.S. imperialists are staging frantic war exercises along the southern coastal areas of the West Sea of Korea as part of the Foal Eagle joint military exercises they kicked off together with the south Korean warmongers. 
					
					 The committee was launched timed to coincide with the exercises. This clearly reveals the U.S. invariable ambition to invade the DPRK. This is only a hysteric spasm of "tiger moths".
					
					 The U.S. warmongers had better behave with prudence, away from their shameful ambition for invasion of the DPRK if they do not want to face the fate of a tiger moth.

articles.title: S. Korea Plans to Introduce Weapons from US
articles.content:
S. Korea Plans to Introduce Weapons from US
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet military authorities are planning to introduce advanced weapons from the United States. 
					 Some days ago, the former and incumbent officers of the air force of the south Korean army handed over confidential military information to the Lockheed Martin Company, the U.S. military monopolies. It contained the "plan of establishing joint weapons system" dealing with the introduction of important weapons and arms buildup of the air force in different periods from 2012 to 2026, the plan of purchasing JASSN, etc.. 
					
					JASSN is a new type advanced weapon designed for a precision air attack on ground target. The south Korean air force has been busy to introduce this weapon since the Yonphyong Island shelling last year. One shell costs 700,000 U.S. dollars.

articles.title: South Headquarters of Pomminryon Calls for Reunifying Country
articles.content:
South Headquarters of Pomminryon Calls for Reunifying Country
						
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) issued an article on April 6 on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of the publication of President Kim Il Sung's work "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country".
					 The article said that the 10-point programme is, indeed, a fair and aboveboard and great reunification programme. The south-north summit meeting in June 2000 was a historic watershed in translating it into practice, in particular, it noted, and went on:
					
					 All the Koreans have keenly acquired the scientific accuracy and truth of the 10-point programme of the great national unity through the struggle to implement the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 No vicious obstructions of the conservative ruling forces can check the dynamic advance of the compatriots, the article said. It called upon all the patriotic people to get firmly united under the uplifted banner of "By our nation itself" and wage the struggle to build a reunified country, the desire of the nation.

articles.title: Meetings of Conveying Relief Fund Held in Japan
articles.content:
Meetings of Conveying Relief Fund Held in Japan
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held at Tohoku Korean Primary and Middle School on Apr. 6 to convey the relief fund to the disaster-hit compatriots in Miyagi Prefecture. General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent relief fund to Koreans in Japan who suffered from the killer quake and ensuing tsunami.
					 Present there were Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), officials of the Headquarters of Miyagi Prefecture of the emergency measure committee of Chongryon, disaster-stricken compatriots and the bereaved families. 
					
					 Ho in his delivery speech said that the relief fund associated with Kim Jong Il's noble compatriotism encourages the Chongryon officials and compatriots. 
					
					 Saying that the Koreans in Japan can overcome whatever difficulty if they are led by Kim Jong Il, Ho called on the officials and compatriots in the prefecture to conduct vigorous rescue operations to recover the Chongryon organization and sincerely help the disaster-hit compatriots by pooling efforts. 
					
					 He conveyed the relief fund to the bereaved families and the disaster-hit Koreans under Chongryon and those under the south Korean Residents Association in Japan (Mindan) as well as those Koreans not affiliated to any of these organizations.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting. 
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was read out there. 
					
					 Ho together with Chongryon officials called at disaster-hit compatriots in Onagawa, Ishinomaki, Shiogama and Tagajo on April 7 to convey the fund. 
					
					 A similar meeting was held in Iwate Prefecture on April 8.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet Website by Swiss Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet Website by Swiss Organization 
						
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on Internet website the full text of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On the Juche Idea" on March 30. 
					 The work, published on March 31, Juche 71 (1982), deals with the immortal historic exploits of President Kim Il Sung who founded the Juche idea and the significance of its foundation. It also refers to the circumstances of foundation, the philosophical principle, the socio-historical principle, the guiding principle and the historic significance of the Juche idea.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported in Thailand and Ethiopia
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported in Thailand and Ethiopia
						
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Thailand and Ethiopia released statements on the occasion of the 18th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country".
					 The Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association in its statement on April 2 said that the work is a great programme which clarifies the orientation and way of achieving reunification by the concerted efforts of the whole nation.
					
					The patriotic idea and line on great national unity advanced by the President are being carried forward and developed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, it added.
					
					 The historic June 15 joint declaration provided by Kim Jong Il is a declaration of the great unity of the whole nation which ushered in an epochal phase of realizing independent reunification and the great national unity.
					
					 The association expressed full support and solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to consolidate national unity under the banner of "By our nation itself" and thus reunify the country at an early date, the statement said.
					
					 The Addis Ababa Youth Association of Ethiopia in its statement on April 4 said that Kim Il Sung in the programme clarified the most fair and realistic ways of putting an end to Korea's division and realizing its reunification at the earliest date.
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated the 10-Point Programme as one element of the Three Charters for National Reunification and provided the June 15 Joint Declaration. He is dedicating his all to country's reunification true to the President's behests, the statement said.
					
					 We positively support the DPRK's sincere efforts to improve the north-south relations and achieve the peaceful reunification through national unity and cooperation.

articles.title: Foreigners Praise Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners Praise Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
						
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi and Indonesian political figures released statements on April 1 to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, and Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, said in a joint statement that Kim Il Sung founded the immortal Juche idea, brightly illuminating the path to be taken by mankind. He also brought into a reality the centuries-old desire of the Korean people to live in a new world free from all kinds of exploitation and suppression, the statement added.
					
					 Today the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il is instilling great strength and courage into the revolutionary people of the world in their endeavors to firmly defend socialist Korea from the moves of the imperialists to stifle it and live in a new independent world, it noted.
					
					 Dilip Barua, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist), said in a statement that thanks to the brilliant ideological and theoretical activities and revolutionary practices of Kim Il Sung the DPRK has turned into a powerful socialist state, adding that the socialist and independent forces standing against imperialism have grown stronger in the international arena.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the NDC of the DPRK was a very significant historic event in realizing global independence, he said.

articles.title: Day of Sun Commemorated in Britain
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated in Britain
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- A special plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) took place in London on April 2 to commemorate the Day of the Sun, birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Ella Rule, vice-chairman and international secretary of the Central Committee of the Party, in his report, praised the immortal exploits of Kim Il Sung who devoted his all to the happiness of the people and realization of global independence all his life.
					
					 He said that the ideas and theories of Kim Il Sung serve as guidelines for the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) aspiring after socialism, adding that all the party members should deeply study them.
					
					 He said that the President had founded the Juche idea, applied it in the revolutionary practices. In particular he had firmly maintained independence in relations with parties of other countries and in the revolution and construction and attached importance to the role of the intellectuals, he added.
					
					 Speakers referred to the experience the Workers' Party of Korea gained in the struggle against modern revisionism and Right and "Left" opportunism, the need of building self-supporting national economy, the issue of relations between independence and proletarian internationalism and others.
					
					The meeting decided to send a letter to General Secretary Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Observed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Observed Abroad
Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Bangladesh, Switzerland and Sweden between April 2 and 3. They were held on the occasions of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 79th anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army.
					 Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, said that the President founded the immortal Juche idea and brightly indicated the road to be followed by the Korean people and the progressives of the world, turning the DPRK into a dignified socialist power.
					
					 The election of Kim Jong Il as chairman of the National Defence Commission provided a sure guarantee for successfully carrying forward the idea and feats of the President and accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche, he noted. 
					
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, said that under the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il the KPA has defended socialism from the imperialists' aggression and successfully performed its role as the main force in building a thriving nation. He spoke highly of the invincible might of the KPA.
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the meetings in Switzerland and Sweden.
					
					 A meeting, photo exhibition and film show were also held in Cuba and film shows in Thailand between April 1 and 4 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of the President.

articles.title: China Calls for Improving Level of Work with Masses
articles.content:
China Calls for Improving Level of Work with Masses
 Beijing, April 8 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, state councilor and minister of Public Security of China, called for serving the people during his survey of Shaanxi Province.
					 He stressed the need for the public security officials to adhere to the basic aim of serving the people with all their efforts and make deep understanding of what they think and want.
					
					 It is necessary to put the security field on IT basis, bolster its ranks and steadily improve the capability and level of defending the state security and social stability, he noted.

articles.title: Illegal Publications Retrieved in China
articles.content:
Illegal Publications Retrieved in China
						
 Beijing, April 8 (KCNA) -- China retrieved 10.818 million copies of illegal publications from January to February this year.
					 9.416 million of them were published in violation of copyright.
					
					 The country is to conduct a dynamic campaign to retrieve and dispose of lewd and indecent publications this year.

articles.title: Number of Martyrs Total 20 Million in China
articles.content:
Number of Martyrs Total 20 Million in China
						
 Beijing, April 8 (KCNA) -- About 20 million martyrs devoted their precious lives to the Chinese revolution and construction since the revolutionary war, according to the Chinese Ministry of Civil Affairs on April 3.
					 About 1.8 million have so far been registered in the list of martyrs through survey.

articles.title: Russia's State Duma Accuses Estonia of Its Step to Distort History
articles.content:
Russia's State Duma Accuses Estonia of Its Step to Distort History
 Moscow, April 8 (KCNA) -- The State Duma of Russia accused the Estonian authorities of their step to distort history.
					 The Estonian Ministry of Defence recently replaced letters reading "Monument to Solider Liberators" with letters "Monument to Soviet Soldiers who Occupied Tallinn on September 22, 1944". The monument stands at the cemetery of Soviet soldiers in Tallinn.
					
					 In this regard Oleg Morozov, first deputy speaker of the State Duma of Russia, denounced it as a provocation of the Estonian authorities and another attempt to distort history.
					
					 This is desecration and vandalism against the Russians, said Leonid Slutski, first vice-chairman of the International Affairs Committee of the State Duma.
					
					Another deputy to the State Duma also denounced it as a mean attempt.

articles.title: Kazakh President Calls for Integration of Eurasia
articles.content:
Kazakh President Calls for Integration of Eurasia
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Kazakh President Nursultan Nazarbayev at a news conferences on April 4 called for the integration of Eurasia.
					 He said that the activities of the tariff union of the Eurasia Economic Community do not violate the sovereignty of any country.
					
					 Integration, the integration of Eurasia, in particular, guarantees its future, he noted, adding that the process of the integration of the community directed towards the creation of a unified economic zone at the next stage is aimed to promote the economic interests of the member nations of the community.

articles.title: Sudan Accuses Israeli Attack
articles.content:
Sudan Accuses Israeli Attack 
						
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- Sudanese Foreign Minister Ali Karti at a press conference on April 6 strongly denounced Israel for launching a missile strike.
					 He said that Israeli planes launched missile strike that killed two passengers near Port Sudan on Tuesday.
					
					 "Sudan reserves its right to react," he said.

articles.title: Cuba Calls for Unity at World Trade Union Congress
articles.content:
Cuba Calls for Unity at World Trade Union Congress 
						
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The general secretary of the Workers' Central Union of Cuba (CTC), Salvador Valdes, called upon trade unionists worldwide to unite as the only way to achieve better working and living conditions, addressing the 16th World Trade Unions Congress in the Greek capital.
					 "Without making any concessions to our principles, we must welcome anyone who, regardless of his tendency or affiliation, is willing to fight for the common goals of the working class," he said.
					
					 The world consequences of neoliberalism cannot be faced separately but together, he added.

articles.title: Fight against Drugs Called for at Cancun Conference
articles.content:
Fight against Drugs Called for at Cancun Conference
						
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The fight against organized crime needs shared responsibility of all involved countries, Mexico's Public Security Minister Genaro Garcia Luna said on Wednesday.
					 Speaking at the 28th International Conference on the Fight against Drugs held in Mexico's state of Cancun on the Yucatan peninsula, Garcia said that in order to systematically and efficiently combat drug trafficking it is necessary to establish an agenda of collaboration to prosecute the production, trafficking and consumption of illegal drugs.

articles.title: New Environmental Radiation Surveillance Station Opened in Iran
articles.content:
New Environmental Radiation Surveillance Station Opened in Iran
 Tehran, April 8 (KCNA) -- Iran inaugurated a new environmental radiation surveillance station as part of its broader plans for expanding the country's nuclear emergency alert systems.
					 Iran has thus added 50 nuclear Emergency Alert System (EAS) stations to the previous 13.

articles.title: New Archeological Discoveries in Northeast Syria
articles.content:
New Archeological Discoveries in Northeast Syria
						
 Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- A total of 20 archeological discoveries, the oldest of which dates back to 3800 B.C., have been unearthed in northeast Syria, state-run SANA news agency reported Tuesday. 
					 They include a 185cm-long statue of female.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia subsidios escolares y becas a hijos de coreanos en Japon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envía subsidios escolares y becas a hijos de coreanos en Japón
						
Pyongyang, 10 de abril (ATCC) -- Con motivo del aniversario 99 del natalicio del Presidente          Kim Il Sung, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il envió a la Asociación General de Coreanos Residentes en Japón (Chongryon) los subsidios escolares y becas equivalentes a 165 millones 200 mil ¥ (moneda japonesa) para la educación nacional democrática de los hijos de los coreanos radicados en Japón.
					El monto de tales fondos, enviados en 157 ocasiones por el Presidente y el Dirigente hasta la fecha, llega a 46 mil 759 millones 450 mil 390 ¥.

articles.title: 24o Torneo Internacional de Maraton por el Premio Mangyongdae
articles.content:
24º Torneo Internacional de Maratón por el Premio Mangyongdae
						
Pyongyang, 10 de abril (ATCC) -- Con motivo del día de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung, tuvo lugar el día 10 en el Estadio Kim Il Sung la Asociación Internacional de Federaciones Atléticas-el 24º Torneo Internacional de Maratón por el Premio Manggyongdae.
					  En la ceremonia inaugural estuvieron presentes el secretario del Comité Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Choe Ryong Hae, el ministro de Construcción e Industria de Materiales de Construcción y presidente de la Asociación de Maratón de la República Popular Democrática de Corea Tong Jong Ho, y otros funcionarios, los deportistas, trabajadores capitalinos y los jugadores de Corea, China, Rusia, Namibia, Sudáfrica, Suecia, Etiopia, Zimbabwe y Kenia.
					
					  En su discurso inaugural, el ministro de Deportes, Pak Myong Chol, expresó la convicción de que este torneo contribuirá a profundizar la amistad entre los deportistas aspirantes a la independencia, la paz y la amistad y desarrollar en común la técnica de Maratón.
					
					  Se izó la bandera del torneo.
					
					  Acto seguido, hubo la competencia de Maratón.
					
					  Más de 300 jugadores de ambos sexos partieron de la línea de salida.
					
					  En la competencia el jugador ruso Marusin Oleg y la coreana Ro Un Ok  ocuparon primeros lugares, el keniata Mwange Morris Mureithi y la coreana An Un Suk, segundos lugares, el sudafricano Ngakane David Rasefako y la coreana Pak Jong Nyo, terceros lugares, respectivamente.
					
					  En la ceremonia clausural se otorgaron la copa de victoria, medalla, diploma a los jugadores que lograron buenas notas.

articles.title: Inaugurado 27 Festival Artistico de Amistad Abril
articles.content:
Inaugurado 27 Festival Artístico de Amistad Abril 
						
Pyongyang, 10 de abril (ATCC) -- Quedó inaugurado el día 10 en el Palacio de Deportes Jong Ju Yong de Ryukyong el 27º Festival Artístico de Amistad Abril en Primavera.
					  En la ocasión estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema Yang Hyong Sop, el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros Kang Nung Su, el ministerio de Cultura y presidente del Comité Organizador del Festival An Tong Chun y otros funcionarios, trabajadores capitalinos, artistas extranjeros y artistas coreanos en ultramar, las delegaciones de varios países, los representantes diplomáticos, representantes de las organizaciones internacionales, miembros de las embajadas acreditados en Corea, huéspedes extranjeros y coreanos en ultramar.
					
					  An Tong Chun, en su discurso de apertura, dijo que el presente festival servirá de motivo significativo de que los artistas de varios países del mundo intercambian los éxitos y experiencias logrados en el desarrollo de cultura y contribuyen al desarrollo de cultura y arte de la humanidad.
					
					  Él declaró la inauguración del 27º Festival Artístico de Amistas Abril en Primavera refiriéndose a que el certamen se concluirá magníficamente conforme a la esperanza del pueblo coreano, hombres de cultura y artistas progresistas.
					
					  Los artistas de varios países y de Corea izaron la bandera del festival en el lugar de ceremonia inaugural.
					
					  Pronunciaron discursos de felicitación el diputado perteneciente a la Unión de Movimiento Popular de Francia, Jean-Francois Mancel y el jefe de la Orquesta Sinfónica de la provincia de Jilin, China, Zhang Hao.
					
					  Por último, los artistas coreanos ofrecieron un espectáculo.

articles.title: Huespedes extranjeros rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Huéspedes extranjeros rinden homenaje a Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, 10 de abril (ATCC) -- Rindieron el día 10 sublime homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung en el Palacio Memorial Kumsusan el diputado perteneciente a la Unión de Movimiento Popular de Francia, Jean-Francois Mancel, huésped honorario del 27º Festival Artístico de Amistad Abril en Primavera, y su comitiva y otros huéspedes extranjeros.
					  Ellos dejaron letras en el libro de visitas.
